And because transformation begins from within, we’re seeking the people to drive it. So, calling all curious.Come ready to explore and you’ll find a place where your talent takes flight—beyond the borders of title, a country or your comfort zone. Bring your passion and commitment and we’ll welcome you into a tight-knit team that takes our mission personally. Channel your drive to make a difference into shaping an organization and an industry that’s evolving fast to the future.Innovation through diversity of thought. At Pratt & Whitney, we believe diversity of thought enables creativity, innovation, and a foundation for inclusion. By fostering an inclusive culture, we accept a shared accountability and responsibility to recognize, sponsor, coach, hire and promote talent equally. We welcome our employees to be their whole - best - selves at work because trust, respect and integrity, are a part of our DNA.At Pratt & Whitney, the difference you make is on display every day. Just look up. Are you ready to go beyond?Job Summary:The Pratt & Whitney Aftermarket Systems Engineering team is a worldwide organization hyper-focused on the needs of our commercial airline customers and driving profitability. As P&W engines fly, engine data is transmitted to us and processed through our Advanced Diagnostic Engine Management (ADEM) system. We evaluate the system performance of the engine both on-wing and off-wing enabled by data science techniques to allow for efficient fleet management for the commercial aftermarket and customer support teams. Our group also develops and maintains cross-program functional tools & methods utilized by the internal P&W field / production / overhaul teams. We decrease analysis tool fragmentation and ensure field learning is proliferate into earlier engine design phases.The Aftermarket Systems Engineering team is looking for a Principal Analytics Engineer who will focus on engineering enabled decision making tools and methods to optimize the business. The candidate will work along-side other groups within engineering inclusive of the Engine Design & Systems Integration and aftermarket organizations developing analytics.Key Responsibilities:Ownership of a product development backlogDevelopment of tools & analytics that enable smart engine work scopingMaintaining & creating analytics / dashboards to manage the as flown commercial fleetEnabling automation of engineering in the Interval Cost Estimator (ICE) toolAiding field support and other EDSI organizations with big data tool setsEngage in process changes through CORE and the leadership operating modelBasic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in engineering with 8+ years prior analytics engineering experience, or An Advanced Degree with 5+ years’ experience8+ years’ experience in Advanced Python proficiency5+ years with Applied experience working with large datasets and using SQL2+ Experience with data science, machine learning and DevOpsU.S. Person or eligible to obtain necessary export authorizations required. Preferred Qualifications:Experience working in a SCRUM frameworkAn understanding and/or eagerness to learn with respect to other engine systems including mechanical, vibration dynamics, externals, and controls. Aerothermal systems analysis experienceDemonstrated leadership and self-direction. Willingness to both teach others and learn new techniques. Effective written and verbal communication skills.
